resources.string: Coronavirus disease 2019(COVID-19) is an infectious disease caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2(SARS-CoV-2).

World Health Organization announced on 11th February 2020 that “COVID-19” would be the official name of the disease. “Co” for Corona, “Vi” for Virus, “Di” for disease and “19” for 2019 which is the year the outbreak was identified.
The disease was first identified in 2019 in Wuhan, Central China, and has since spread globally, resulting in the 2019–2020 coronavirus pandemic.

The virus is typically spread from one person to another via respiratory droplets produced during coughing. It may also be spread from touching contaminated surfaces and then touching one\'s face. Fecal-oral transmission is also being studied as the virus has been found in patients stool.

Fever is a key symptom of infection. Experts say don’t fixate on a number, but know it’s really not a fever until your body temperature reaches at least 37.7º Celsius (100º Fahrenheit) for children and adults.
Coughing is also a key symptom of infection but not just any cough, a dry cough that you feel in your chest.
Flu-like symptoms such as a runny nose has also been identified as symptom of infection.

Shortness of breath can be a very serious manifestation of COVID-19, and it can occur on its own, without a cough. If your chest begins to feel tight or you begin to feel as if you cannot breathe deeply enough to get a good breath, that’s a sign to act.
Experts have also report that a majority of patients reported having sore throat.
Experts have also reported that some patients who have COVID-19 have complained of having a headache.

Wash your hands often with water and soap for at least 20 seconds, or use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer that contains at least 60% alcohol. Also avoid touching your eyes, nose and mouth if your hands aren\'t clean.

Avoid large crowds and gatherings. Also avoid close contact (about 6 feet) with anyone who is sick or has symptoms. Stay home from work, school and public areas to avoid spreading or getting the disease.

If you are infected with the disease use a face mask to cover your mouth to prevent infecting others and change it often. Cover your mouth and nose with your elbow or a tissue when you cough or sneeze. Throw away the used tissue.
